content.description: You need several pads, like most lines in the Ice Caves.
content.location:
It is on the opposite wall from

The Vampire (aka Sabbath Bloody Sabbath?)

.

Start up the slab, then move to a large sloper from thumbdercling seams. Dyno from sloper to a large jug out to the right!

content.description:
Climbs a right-leaning finger crack out a chimney chute, 5.8 if you use the this climb like a chimney.

Topout or rap off a tree back into the cave.
content.location:
If you are looking at

The Vampire

, it is directly behind you.

content.description:
Start in hole to the bottom right of

The Vampire

. Trickiness gains the crack.
content.location:
It is in the Ice Caves and is an alternate start to

The Vampire

.

content.description: This is a flared finger crack in a Ice Cream Scooped cave, it climbs out the roof to a walkoff.
content.protection: C3-#00, quickdraw for pin, and a C3-#0. Yellow Alien, blue Alien, purple TCU.
content.location: In the main Ice Cave, it is the route that has a piton part way, and you climb the finger crack out the cave and top it out.

content.description: Start in a polished scoop, stemming up the interior. Dyno backwards to a jug with a huge swing, and then mantle into the next scoop. Collect your thoughts, and ease up the cool fin feature to slopers, and more slopers at the top. Don't fall. One could bail out at one spot....
content.location:
Go about 60' up canyon from

The Vampire (aka Sabbath Bloody Sabbath?)

, on the left. Start on a pedestal at the base of a large, polished scoop.

content.description: This has a high start, depending on the ice level..., awesome rock, and fun moves up to a fin mantle.
content.location: This route is the first thing you pass as you enter the bottom end of the ice caves, on your right.

content.description:
Start as for

The Vampire (aka Sabbath Bloody Sabbath?)

, then follow a small crimpy seam up to the top of

Cobra Commander

and top out for the same.

This is a lower start to

Devet

, adding a couple hard compression moves.

Per

Christian

: begin on the horizontal, and compress up slopers for your left hand and crimps for your right hand.
content.location:
Sit start to

Devet

when the ice is gone.

Per

Christian

: this is at the South entrance to the Ice Caves. It is the very first boulder problem you'll see on the right side.

content.description: Start on the arete and a left hand edge, squeeze up the huge, black fridge to a final crux move to and from a thin seam from slopers.
content.location:
It is 10' right of

The Vampire (aka Sabbath Bloody Sabbath?)

.

content.description:
This is a really awesome, cobra's-hood feature on great granite. It shares a start with

The Vampire (aka Sabbath Bloody Sabbath?)

, but cut up and left into the guts of the hood via polished pinches and slopers. It has a very high and committing topout follows the mantle onto the cobra head.
content.location:
This is 5' left of

The Vampire (aka Sabbath Bloody Sabbath?)

.
